PLEASE NOTE
This questionnaire is intended for persons who came to Saskatchewan before 1921, although information for later years may be included.
If you cannot answer a question, skip it. We realize that any one person will not be able to answer all questions.
Use extra sheets of paper if there is not enough space on the questionnaire.

Your co-operation in answering this questionnaire is greatly appreciated. All questionnaires are preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives.

1. Services of a Doctor

   1. How far were you from the nearest doctor at first? (24 miles in London)

   2. Was there any closer settlement nearby? (Explain the circumstances)

   3. What was your opinion of the competence of the pioneer doctor in your district? (a good physician? a good surgeon? Explain why.)

   4. Was it customary to go to the same (or family) doctor in all situations, or did it depend on the nature of the illness?

   5. Was the doctor consulted at his office or called to your house? (Explain the circumstances)

   6. What conditions were usually treated without reference to a doctor, and which were of a nature that led to consultation?

   7. Do you recall how much you paid for doctors' calls or services?

   8. What did this amount to annually for yourself? (for your family?)

   9. If you have preserved accounts for medical services, would you supply a record of payments for specific illnesses, operations, etc.? Did costs ever deter you from consulting a doctor?

   10. Were farm products or other services exchanged for treatment received? Give examples.

II. Hospital Services

8. Where was your nearest hospital? How far away was this? Who organized it and how was it supported?

How many beds did it have? How large was its staff?

Did you feel that patients received good care in it?

9. For what illnesses did members of your family enter hospital?

My mother had a tumor removed from her lip. She was treated in Regina Hospital.

10. Do you recall how much was charged for hospitalization on these occasions? $60

11. For what illnesses were members of your family confined to bed at home?

I had influenza—shut myself up when I was 18 years old.

12. Did other members of the family look after the sick person?

Was there a registered nurse or other person in the district who assisted on these occasions?

13. In the case of contagious diseases, were sick members isolated from the rest of the family?

14. Were children born at home or did the mother go to hospital?

If the mother remained at home, was there a doctor, midwife, nurse, or another woman who assisted and which was preferred?

15. What home remedies did you use for various illnesses? (Specify)

Consulted for remedies?

IV. Public Health Problems

22. Were members of your family vaccinated or inoculated against contagious diseases? (State diseases and dates.)

Was this done by the family doctor at his suggestion or at the family's request, or was there a definite campaign carried on in the district with arrangements made for immunization of the children and/or adults at one time?

23. Do you recall epidemics in your district in which quarantine was enforced? Upon whose orders was this carried out?

(Give details of the epidemic)

24. Was there ever an outbreak of typhoid fever in your community? (Describe.) What was considered to be the source of infection and what steps were taken to remedy the situation?

25. Was it ever found necessary to close your local school because of an epidemic? (Specify the occasion.)
